title: Chicago resident says deploying the National guard would be a ‘band-aid’
description: Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes says deploying the National Guard would only be a band-aid and not a solution to the violence that has plagued the city. She chats with CNN’s Omar Jimenez about what she thinks needs to be done.
content:
Chicago resident says deploying the National guard would be a ‘band-aid’ Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes says deploying the National Guard would only be a band-aid and not a solution to the violence that has plagued the city. She chats with CNN's Omar Jimenez about what she thinks needs to be done. Chicago resident says deploying the National guard would be a ‘band-aid’

Russian President Vladimir Putin’s four-day visit to China marks a powerful show of unity with Chinese leader Xi Jinping - and is his longest foreign trip since the invasion of Ukraine. From summits to military parades, the two have underscored their personal rapport and shared ambition to reshape a global order they see as dominated by the West. CNN’s Simone McCarthy explores how Beijing and Moscow’s steadfast strategic alignment, despite recent diplomatic overtures between Moscow and Washington.

Man found dead in pool of blood at Burning Man A man found dead in a pool of blood is being investigated as a homicide at the annual Burning Man festival in the northwestern Nevada desert, according to the Pershing County Sheriff’s Office. The sheriff's office has yet to identify the man and no other information was released. Man found dead in pool of blood at Burning Man

What we know about the Afghanistan earthquake Hundreds of people have been killed and thousands more left injured after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit Afghanistan’s mountainous eastern region on Sunday. Rescuers are scrambling to reach hard-hit, remote communities as landslides and destroyed roads hamper their efforts. What we know about the Afghanistan earthquake

A Cessna 172 and an Extra Flugzeugbau EA300 airplane collided midair Sunday at an airport in Colorado, killing one person and injuring three more. The incident occurred as both planes attempted to land, according to authorities. The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board are both investigating.

Border Patrol agents arrested two firefighters on Wednesday, who they say were in the United States illegally, while they were working to contain Washington state’s biggest wildfire. CNN's Priscilla Alvarez reports.

‘I do have remorse’: Bookie reflects on Ohtani gambling scandal CNN’s Nick Watt sits down with former bookmaker and gambler, Matt Bowyer, who was recently sentenced to a year in prison for his part in a scandal that saw millions stolen from the famed LA Dodgers pitcher by Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter, Ippei Mizuharu. ‘I do have remorse’: Bookie reflects on Ohtani gambling scandal

New generations are learning about Hurricane Katrina 20 years ago when Hurricane Katrina devastated the Gulf Coast and New Orleans, social media was just starting to gain popularity. Today, new generations are learning about the depth of the devastation and posting their reactions on social media. Survivors, many of whom were just babies or children two decades ago, are responding with their own stories about the trauma they experienced and the issues that still linger today. New generations are learning about Hurricane Katrina

Lessons from Katrina are being forgotten under Trump Hurricane Katrina was a watershed moment in American disaster response and led to a massive overhaul of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). Twenty years later those efforts to bolster the nation’s emergency management system are being undone. CNN's Gabe Cohen reports. Lessons from Katrina are being forgotten under Trump

New Zealand police have released CCTV footage they believe shows fugitive father Thomas Callam Phillips stealing groceries from a store in the North Island town of Piopio, accompanied by one of his children. Phillips is accused of hiding his three children - Jayda, Maverick, and Ember - in the New Zealand wilderness after disappearing with them in December 2021.
summary: Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes believes that deploying the National Guard would only be a band-aid solution to the violence within the city. Russian President Vladimir Putin's four-day visit to China is seen as a powerful show of unity with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, marking his longest foreign trip since the invasion of Ukraine. A man was found dead in a pool of blood at the Burning Man festival in the Nevada desert is being investigated as a homicide. A Cessna 172 and an Extra Flugzeugbau EA300 airplane collided midair in Colorado, killing one person and injuring three more. Border Patrol agents have arrested two firefighters who they say were in the United States illegally working to contain Washington state’s largest wildfire. New Zealand police have released CCTV footage they believe shows fugitive father Thomas Callam Phillips stealing groceries from a store in the North Island town of Piopio.
shortSummary: Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes advocates deploying the National Guard to address violence in the city, while Russia's Vladimir Putin visits China for the first time since the Ukraine invasion.

argos_summary: Chicago resident Rochelle Sykes argues that deploying the National Guard to Chicago would only be a temporary band‑aid, not a lasting solution to the city’s violence, and she discusses this view with CNN’s Omar Jimenez. The story also briefly mentions other unrelated events, such as Vladimir Putin’s visit to China, a death at Burning Man, an Afghanistan earthquake, a midair collision in Colorado, and other news snippets.
